technology.short_description: Wakhaf repelled the nomads and secured the borders. He is a peerless master of desert warfare.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Wakhaf to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: Conquering lands beyond the mountains east of Nehekhara, Rakhash was a bringer of great prosperity.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Rakhash to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: The son of Khetep ruled only briefly before his death, but his grasp of engineering and urban development were legendary.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Thutep to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: Lahmizzash continued the fight against Nagash, retaking sacred Khemri with the aid of his potent Ushabti.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Lahmizzash to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: Ruling in the wake of the war with Nagash, Setep restored the Necropolis and the Priesthood to their former glory.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Setep to your faction's Lord pool

technology.onscreen_name: Alkhazzar II of the Sixth Dynasty
technology.short_description: This warrior-king was unmatched in chariot tactics. Only the finest crews served under him - and will again, of courseâ€¦

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Alkhazzar II to your faction's Lord pool

technology.short_description: Ptra is the Sun-God, and first of the pantheon.

technology.short_description: Neru, betrothed of Ptra, is Goddess of the Moon and the 'Great Protector'.

technology.short_description: Khsar is the God of the Desert and its wild winds.

technology.short_description: Asaph is the Goddess of Magic and Vengeance.

technology.short_description: Knowing precisely where to place the killing blow, Rasetra's Crocodile Squadron turned swordplay into an art form.

items.colour_text: Knowing precisely where to place the killing blow, Rasetra's Crocodile Squadron turned swordplay into an art form.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Deathblow" for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen, Skeleton Archers and Tomb Guard units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: A First Dynasty master mason, Pehenna single-handedly crafted the Charnel Valley statuary.
Beka of Lybaras was chosen as the architect of Khalida's tomb, which was an honour befitting his skill.
Thutmosa's subtle artistry with chisel and mallet earned him the honour of sculpting Settra's throne.
A ruthless slave-driver, Hemiunus was famed for raising the glittering Temple of Sorrow in record time.
Imhetop was First Hammer of Bel-Aliad, City of Dust. Every building there bore his mark.
Inenna the Silent oversaw the construction of Numas, the Scarab City.
The Ushabti of Djaf's Messengers fought with legendary zeal, even as the odds against them grew.

items.colour_text: The Ushabti of Djaf's Messengers fought with legendary zeal, even as the odds against them grew.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Frenzy" for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Patronage of Wakhaf of the First Dynasty, subjugator of nomads.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Tomb Princes

technology.short_description: With gilded bones and magically-honed blades, the Golden Host of Mahrak were the glory of the Third Dynasty.

items.colour_text: With gilded bones and magically-honed blades, the Golden Host of Mahrak were the glory of the Third Dynasty.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Tomb Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Tomb Guard units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Ruling from the glittering capital of Khemri, Settra bound the disparate Priest Kings into the unity of single kingdom and lo, Nehekhara was born.
The Second dynasty marked a period of sweeping territorial expansion and growing prosperity for Nehekhara.
The kingdom prospered further until Nagash's treacherous rise to power, although he was finally defeated by the united Priest Kings.
In the aftermath of Nagash's reign of terror, king succeeded king in a period of great strife, division and civil war.
King Setep usurped the throne of Khemri, restoring the Priesthood and the Necropolis; from then on, Nehekhara began to flourish once more.
A resurgent Nehekhara reached its peak under Alcadizzar. Nagash returned, and after years of war, Nehekhara finally fell into decay.
The envoys and harbingers of a Tomb King, bring about his benevolenceâ€¦ or wrath.
Beguiling and deceptive, the Sphinx Legion of Numas caught countless foes unprepared, even in the open field.

items.colour_text: Beguiling and deceptive, the Sphinx Legion of Numas caught countless foes unprepared, even in the open field.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +12 for Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Through the ancient Necrotect runes inscribed on your marching drums, the Unliving may be driven to march at a greater pace.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Chariot units

technology.short_description: This ancient Nehekharan incantation is capable of raising hosts from â€˜neath the sands, fully armed and charged with the foeâ€™s destruction.

Reload time reduction: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Skeleton Horsemen units

technology.short_description: A ritual supplication to the vulture-headed God of Scavengers shall ensure his spawn make reliable allies.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 for Carrion units

technology.short_description: Though long dead, kingly guardians can be reminded of their oaths of service made in ages past, invigorating them for battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Tomb Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Tomb Guard units

technology.short_description: Studying the splendid cartography of the Fifth Dynasty shows you exactly where to source veteran stock.

effects.description: Attribute: 360 Missile Block for Casket of Souls units (and when mounted on one)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.

Ammunition: +20% for Screaming Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units

technology.short_description: Trinkets and ritual masks bearing Ptra's sigil are bestowed upon your stone guardians, making them fight all the harder.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bows) units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Ushabti units

technology.short_description: With the Vulture-God Ualatp at their backs, the Zandri Blackshields drove their chariots with preternatural speed.

items.colour_text: With the Vulture-God Ualatp at their backs, the Zandri Blackshields drove their chariots with preternatural speed.

technology.short_description: A First-Dynasty graveyard chant has been discovered, imbuing Skeleton Warriors with greater agility in battle.

Melee defence: +5 for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Chariot units

technology.short_description: It is said that a drop of purest venom, placed upon the lips of the sacrificial victim, will rouse the Scorpion-God himself.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units
Melee defence: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units

technology.short_description: If they can disregard their former rivalries and toil together in common cause, Necrotects can achieve engineering wonders.
A burnt offering, combined with the correct ritual address, brings great dexterity to a Necropolis Knight's mount.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Necropolis Knights units
Melee defence: +5 for Necropolis Knights units

technology.short_description: Forbidden scrolls found in the deep desert reveal portals to Usirianâ€™s realm. This is where the Necrosphinx lurk, awaiting to be tethered to a dread statue.
The arrows of the Hawk Legion of Khemri always found their mark at necks, groins and the tiniest chinks in enemy armour.

items.colour_text: The arrows of the Hawk Legion of Khemri always found their mark at necks, groins and the tiniest chinks in enemy armour.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Sepulchral Stalkers units
Melee defence: +5 for Sepulchral Stalkers units

technology.short_description: With minor adjustments to everyday incantations, the dead may be made to rise with greater vigour than they ever knew in life.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Tomb Guard and Hierotitan units
Weapon strength: +10% for Tomb Guard and Hierotitan units

technology.short_description: Fifth Dynasty scrolls show the locations of Necroserpent nests, where the beasts sit coiled beneath the sands, on a bed of howling skulls.

technology.short_description: Huge Sixth Dynasty gold reserves have been recovered - perfect for ornamenting our most prestigious edifices.

technology.short_description: Lacking the painstaking mummification lavished upon the nobility, these warriors have, through an aeon of death-sleep, been desiccated into indefatigable loyalty.

Recruit rank: +2 for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Chariot units

technology.short_description: These war-statues exhude timeless sophistication, in stark contrast to their ghoulish, blood-slicked ornamentation.

effects.description: Splash attack power: +20% for Bone Giant units

technology.short_description: The mere presence of a mortuary disciple in the mausolean stillness bestirs the desert-dwelling husks, from the scavengers of Uulatp to the swarms of Sokth.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Death from Above" for The Flock of Djaf unit
Attribute: Perfect Vigour for Carrion and Tomb Scorpion units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

technology.short_description: Radiant idols are sculpted to allow the hierophant inside to conjoin the mortal world with the Realm of Souls, lending power to funereal incantations.

effects.description: Leadership +10 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
Cooldown: -15% to "Spirit Leech" and "Shem's Burning Gaze" for Hierotitan units

technology.short_description: Gaze now in despair at the coils of the column that rises from the red-hot sand. Crowned by baleful orbs, they gleam with the eddying hues of sombre iris.

effects.description: Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Necropolis Knights

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

technology.short_description: Imbued with the undying will of Nehekhara's kings, the sacred war-statuary grant a measure of their stone-like resilience and ceaseless vigilance to the legions.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

technology.short_description: March, my legions - plant the seeds of civilisation upon the lands of Nehek!

enabled_if: Realm of Souls Tier 3 is reached

technology.short_description: The invention â€“ and macabre opulence â€“ of Nehekharan war chariots swelled their hosts, for it was deemed indecorous for highborn blood to touch the brutish draught beasts.

technology.short_description: Be they sentries of the inner sanctums enshrined in vast lycea or superstitiously-interred in the deepest desert chasms, these mythical colossi are difficult to disentomb.
